backend/main.mo: Motoko canister implementing anonymous chat rooms with message storage, 24-hour TTL filtering, reactions, replies, edits, and media blobs, using Maps and Lists with authorization and blob-storage mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Machine-readable report listing frontend features related to clickable reply previews, jump-to-message behavior, retry handling for missing messages, affected files, dependencies, and test requirements.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Aggregated documentation-style JSON summarizing the purpose and behavior of frontend and backend source files for planning and reference.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point defining the root container and loading the React application via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component managing global theme, room and nickname state, and conditional rendering between the welcome screen and chat room layout.
frontend/src/components/AudioRecorder.ts: UI component for recording audio via MediaRecorder with permission handling, duration limits, preview playback, and send/cancel controls.
frontend/src/components/ChatRoom.tsx: Primary chat interface handling message list rendering, jump-to-message logic, replies, edits, deletions, reactions, media uploads, recording modals, scrolling behavior, and optimistic updates.
frontend/src/components/EmojiPicker.tsx: Popup emoji picker UI grouped by categories, allowing users to select and insert emojis into messages.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Renders a simple footer with a copyright notice, heart icon, and external link to caffeine.ai using Tailwind styles.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Sticky top header showing the SecureChat logo/title and an optional "Leave Room" button when a callback is provided.
frontend/src/components/MediaPicker.tsx: Provides a modal UI for selecting media, including Tenor GIF search, custom sticker uploads with validation, and localStorage persistence with a 24-hour TTL.
frontend/src/components/MessageBubble.ts: Displays an individual chat message with avatars, replies, reactions, media (image/audio/video) handling, and controls for reply, edit, delete, and react.
frontend/src/components/VideoRecorder.ts: Empty or placeholder file with no implementation.
frontend/src/components/VideoUploader.ts: Allows users to select, preview, validate, and upload video files with playback controls, progress simulation, and error handling.
frontend/src/components/WelcomeScreen.ts: Landing screen for creating or joining chat rooms, featuring a hero section, feature highlights, and nickname/room code inputs.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and caches a backend actor based on Internet Identity, initializes access control, and invalidates dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context, hook, and provider for Internet Identity authentication, managing login/logout, identity persistence, and detailed login status using Dfinity AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for chat features including room creation, room existence checks, and sending messages with optimistic UI updates via a backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Sets up Tailwind CSS base styles, design tokens via CSS variables, dark mode theming, and mobile-specific viewport, safe-area, and iOS input behavior fixes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app, wrapping it with React Query and Internet Identity providers and loading global styles.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility helpers for reading, persisting, and clearing URL and hash-based parameters with sessionStorage support, including safe removal of sensitive hash params.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration enabling class-based dark mode, custom theme extensions tied to CSS variables, container settings, animations, and additional plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata and high-level description of SecureChat, an anonymous real-time chat web app with a React SPA frontend and Internet Computer (Motoko) backend. Enumerates existing features and behaviors (room creation/joining, anonymous sessions, real-time messaging, media, replies, edits/deletes, reactions) with IDs, descriptions, and versions for build planning.
